Azureblade was caught by the blinding beam, but he stayed calm as his
sword=
 and Animus`s locked together.

Azureblade: Now, you die.

His jammed optic=
s eerily sought out Animus's face and the predatory
grin slowly turned into=
 a savage laugh.

Unexpectedly, the attack started elsewhere than where Ani=
mus was
looking. It came right at the center of his spark. Slowly, the
Prot=
oform Z part of Azureblade was trying to tear its way into the
Minion's ver=
y spark.

AzureBlade: My legacy... Protoform X could feed off fear inside a=

spark... He was botched... I will rip out your very mind!


--- In nbwrpg@=
yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> 
> --- Nic <=
warriorazure@...> wrote:
> 
> > AzureBlade: Right... I've played with you l=
ong enough...
> > 
> > In midair, he cut the main thrusters, switches to ro=
bot mode, and
> > dives, sword first, towards Animus.
> > 
> > AzureBlade: =
Fear me... I am no Decepticon, no Autobot. I am the One
> > who was crafted=
, forged, cast and assembled, the One who Slays. I am
> > here to tell you,=
 Minions, that you are not safe anymore. I am
> > Protoform Z!
> > 
> > He =
was submerged by the energy flare. It engulfed him, but he
> > continued. H=
e was still whole, still deadly, and the spots where his
> > armor had been=
 worn were even already beginning to grow back. He was
> > still thrusting =
with his sword, ready to spear Animus on it. His grin
> > could have sent s=
hivers down the circuits of even Ironhide...
> 
> Animus watched as the for=
m of Azureblade broke through one of his
> toughest attacks, healing his da=
mage along the way. The expression on
> Animus' face was one of dismay, fru=
stration and perhaps even a little
> fear. Animus stepped back a step as he=
 did a mental swallow, thinking
> that perhaps this battle might be more th=
an he had bargained for. 
> 
> But as Azure approached, his long blade set =
out before him a calm
> reslove spread over Animus' features. If he was to =
die, then he would
> do so as a minion of Unicron, not as a fleeing simplet=
on! 
> 
> Animus set himself, waiting for Azure (or is that Protoform Z?) t=
o
> approach at high speed, at the last moment Animus fired a blinding beam=

> of light at Azure blade as Animus leaped into the air, thrusting down
> =
with his sword at the same time, in the desperate hope that the
> possibly =
blinded Azureblade would pass through and be vulnerable to
> this attack!
>=
 
> Preston
> (Animus)
